website_summaries.verdict: A great option for vegetarians or those looking for a lower dose of vitamin A.
pros: each tablet contains 5,000 IU of vitamin A from retinyl palmitate
Includes vitamin C to help with absorption
Soy free and suitable for vegetarians
cons: Has a lower vitamin A dosage than many other brands

customer_reviews.title: Another great thing is that they do not contain fish oil ...
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had issues with my stubborn hormonal acne, as no face wash or blemish treatment seemed to work. Once I started taking these (along with a few other supplements) my hormonal acne has finally gone away! Another great thing is that they do not contain fish oil like every other vitamin A supplement I came across, which was a problem because I am vegetarian. I will continue to purchase this item!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian V

customer_reviews.title: Potent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great supplement. My daughter suffers from cystic acne and her health coach recommended this product in conjunction with several others. Seeing positive results within 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Cindie

customer_reviews.title: Love Solgar vitamins!
customer_reviews.text: Looked all over for non-fish oil vitamin A 5000 IU's and finally found them! They used to be standard but have since changed in my area to 8,000 IU's. I have issues with fish oil so to find them in a dry tablet and in the amount of IU's I wanted was a huge plus! Too much supplemental Vitamin A is not good for me (makes me dizzy) so the 5,000 IU's are perfect! The tablets are not huge, they are rather flat and somewhat small, so they are easy to swallow. Solgar is my go-to for quality vitamins.They have helped my vision and I will continue to take them so long as they are available.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Mom

customer_reviews.title: great for acne prone skin
customer_reviews.text: I've use this to control my acne pron skin and ever since I've use it my skin has gotten clearer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for your nails and skin
customer_reviews.text: Have been taking for several months. These are small tablets the size of aspirin. Good for your nails and skin. Will keep buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solgar rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say whether I liked these or didn’t because o really couldn’t tell a difference. I got them to hopefully help heal my skin from the inside out. Nutrition is always the longest lasting solution health wise, and I was lacking in this vitamin. I only wish this had been the solution for me, but alas, I’ll keep researching. Also, Solgar makes THE BEST vitamins and supplements out there. Theirs are the only kind I can take because they are pure and formulated safely so as to not interact with my anti rejection drugs.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Wenning

customer_reviews.title: Good company, good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, as the doses are closer to normal, not super high, as I couldn't find anything else of that strength. The pharmacies have really high dosages, that can be dangerous, as Vitamin A accumulates, and it is easy to overdose, that can be dangerous.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it works better for others but taking these (even just every other day) made me very nauseous. So I won't be using the rest of them

customer_reviews.title: Made me break out!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because vitamin A is known to help with acne and overall skin issues. After only one day of taking it I broke out! Since it was my first time taking a vitamin A supplement I'm not sure if it is this one specifically that gave me a reaction or if all vitamin A supplements would do the same to me but since then I have stopped taking it.

customer_reviews.text: so I have nodular acne, which is pretty severe. no cysts, just lots of inflammation and acne all over my cheeks. I’ve used prescription before but the acne always came back so I just gave up on that. anyways I’ve been taking one pill a day for a month now, been drinking lots of water (about 64ml a day) and have a pretty natural ingredient, not harsh facial wash daily routine and this pill hasn’t really made any difference. :( would not purchase again. Maybe it works only for people who have mild to very little acne but not severe as mine.

customer_reviews.title: Hormonal acne survivor. Happy with the results!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 28 with a hormonal iud. I'm taking this along with the Solgar calcium magnesium zinc, Spectrum Essentials Fish oil with vitamin D, and Source Naturals N-acetyl cysteine! And I really can't recommend it enough. Skin care routine: Bedu Camel milk African black soap + Thayer's witch hazel + Andalou Naturals Recovery Cream, Argan Stem Cell And making sure that I get my probiotics! (Kombucha is my go to) I'm happy it's over and I can stop spending money on different products. Hope this helps anyone else that is suffering with awful hormonal acne.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Great for skin probs!

I eat well, exercise a lot, and drink a ton of water as well as switched to all natural skin cleansers and moisturizers but it wasn't until I started taking these vitamins that my skin cleared up. And it only took about a week. Will buy again!

customer_reviews.title: Great, low-dose Vitamin A.  Easy to break up.
customer_reviews.text: Really helped me. I feel so much better taking this. Apparently, I don't convert carotenoids to vitamin A very well. I like that this is low dose. I break each tablet in four pieces and take a quarter with my meals—twice or three times a day.

customer_reviews.title: Skin care, vision and Immune health

customer_reviews.title: Better than softgels for me
customer_reviews.text: I used this and saw noticeable results in my skin tone. I then switched to softgels thinking they’d be more potent (it was also a higher dose). Unfortunately the softgels were from fish oil which my body has never agreed with. It not only made me breakout, but it gives me mood problems as well. I’m so glad it finally clicked in my head that the recent problems I was having were related to the softgels. I had no idea they were from fish oil 🤦🏻‍♀️. Dry vitamin a is the way to go for me!

customer_reviews.text: The vitamins are in a real glass bottle which I like, and I assume it is the quality is just as good as any vitamin I have taken in the past. Being over 40 I remember when all vitamins came in glass bottles and I like things especially anything I consume in my body to go in glass because of all the petroleum in plastic + plastic is not 100% recyclable. A little FYI plastic is only 7% recyclable, so I think we should push our government to encourage our manufacturers to use glass for everything possible.

Cannot take the pills. I was on accutane months ago and wanted to keep a strict regime for my skin care routine & wanted to add this to it. Clearly cannot. 2 stars because it is what the description says it is as far as I can tell but I cannot digest them properly for some unknown reason

product_meta.title: Dry Vitamin A 1500 mcg (5000 IU) Tablets - 100 Count
product_meta.description: Solgar Natural Vitamin A supports the health of the immune system and skin, as well as healthy eyes and vision.
feature_bullets: Free of : Gluten, Wheat, Dairy, Soy, Yeast, Preservatives, Artificial Flavours or Colours
As a food supplement for adults, one (1) tablet daily, preferably at mealtime, or as directed by a healthcare practitioner. Do not exceed directions for use
Convenient Dry tablet: This formulation of Vitamin A is offered in a convenient, dry tablet form. This form is ideal for those who may have difficulty consuming other oil-based supplements

Health Benifits: Vitamin A offers a variety of health benefits. Vitamin A supports the health of the immune system as well as promotes healthy skin. In addition Vitamin A supports healthy eyes and vision
